Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
If you want to "jump in" on an existing project, then js is a "need to know"
If you want to create lasting apps that appeal to users, there are many GUI options that work cross-platform with different backend languages
Full disclosure: My answers are colored by my bias against the fad of using glorified web pages as "apps"

Author: {RSM} Skywall#8892
Content:
Hello @jl777c  I have a question it is not directly  linked with KMD but linked to the blockchain. I am testing one competitor  of KMD they claim to have 2 sec block time what I did is to send 5000 transaction via script and I have noticed some steange things:
1 - the sender wallet ballance was jumping up  and down it goes 0 then 2min later to 1000 then 0 then 500 and eventually it went to 0 
Same thing with reception adress
2- my script log the response when sending transactions and i have notices that after some time is start to respond  with not enought funds and later it was send a teansaction and then not enoughr funds and send 5 or 6 trabsactions later

Author: {RSM} Skywall#8892
Content: My question is , do you think that it is the normal behaviour of blockchaon or there is something worng and my trabsaction are causing forks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: likely it is due to change utxo

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content: if it's utxo based it can be normal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to do a more controlled tx throughput tests make 1000 (or 5000) utxos

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of the required size

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: cant rule out reorg issues, but it could just be unconfirmed change outputs

Author: {RSM} Skywall#8892
Content: No it is not . It accounting based. True POS based on nxt code

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, then it does seem strange, but do the balances end up what it should

Author: {RSM} Skywall#8892
Content: Yeah it does because the block reorg but as i sent all the transaction to the same address it is ok but what if i was sending to an exchange and and to my slef it could endup with double spending no

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if enough confirmations are not waited for so the amounts converge, then yes it is a problem

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Crossposted from ccgeneral to have jl777 thoughts on this system

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Wow, I just realised something, but I'm having 1 problem of certainty. A company my company works with uses a system called LPS for supply chain management of car parts and to make sure each part individually goes through all the processes by making a log of when it goes from station to station with an attatched anotator  of whether the part passed or failed the previous process based on parameter window limits. A blockchain is literally keymade for this type of part of tracking but would decentralized nodes holding the database fair better than a Centralized super computer server managing this kind of push/pull query. Honestly on second thought it definitely has to be better, because of the local data holding over a Centralized server having to do pushes and pulls whereas a blockchain only has pushes.

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Is my logic sound at the end

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Having local databases that are queryable should be infinitely faster than having to do pulls from a central server that is also managing every pull and push of multiple machines that are integrated into this system(every cell has a LPS drop to log and pull down info of said process and to check if said parts previous process was successful based on an independent review of parameters against hard coded limits{not able to be edited by low level programming personnel}).

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
hi @BlackJesus 
This tech tuesday has a supply chain scenario.   have a look at the json data structure, and see if something similar will fit in your car part scenario.   if it's just checking somethiing off, it's changing the state of some json object maybe.   each tx to blockchain just adjusts state.   just becomes a GUI integration with object's state changes i guess...

https://komodoplatform.com/tech-tuesday-update-7/

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Will do @Mylo

Author: jusoaresf#3291
jl777c#5810
Content: chaintip doesnt have a nextblockhash

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content: chaintip?

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content:
not the newest block, previous ones like
```komodo-cli getblock 000000010c190aae0682b1e0e07b377714bb7a65d8ff4e5b21554b26432bfbd1```

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content: it will show nextblockhash but that info i not on that block  itself (?)

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
```$ komodo-cli help getblock
getblock "hash|height" ( verbosity )

If verbosity is 0, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for the block.
If verbosity is 1, returns an Object with information about the block.
If verbosity is 2, returns an Object with information about the block and information about each transaction.```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jusoaresf The nextblock hash cannot be on block itself as blocks are not modified when next block arrives. That info is shown from the deamon as it knows for each block which one is previous and which is the next.
